1.brief: to be clear (orig. of sound, but usually of color); to shine; hence, to make ashow, to boast; and thus to be (clamorously) foolish; to rave; causatively, to celebrate; also to stultify

the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)

properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)

properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a mass of persons (or figuratively, things), especially reg. organized forwar (an army); by implication, a campaign, literally or figuratively (specifically, hardship, worship)

the sun; by implication, the east; figuratively, a ray, i.e. (architectural) a notched battlement
to be clear (orig. of sound, but usually of color); to shine; hence, to make ashow, to boast; and thus to be (clamorously) foolish; to rave; causatively, to celebrate; also to stultify

illumination or (concrete) luminary (in every sense, including lightning, happiness, etc.)

the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)

who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.

5.brief: to be clear (orig. of sound, but usually of color); to shine; hence, to make ashow, to boast; and thus to be (clamorously) foolish; to rave; causatively, to celebrate; also to stultify
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
(absolutely) to create; (qualified) to cut down (a wood), select, feed (as formative processes)

6.brief: to stand, in various relations (literal and figurative, intransitive and transitive)
properly, a (peremptory) terminus, i.e. (by implication) duration, in the sense of advance or perpetuity (substantially as a noun, either with or without a preposition)
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always
an enactment; hence, an appointment (of time, space, quantity, labor or usage)
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)

7.brief: to be clear (orig. of sound, but usually of color); to shine; hence, to make ashow, to boast; and thus to be (clamorously) foolish; to rave; causatively, to celebrate; also to stultify
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
a marine or land monster, i.e. sea-serpent or jackal
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
an abyss (as a surging mass of water), especially the deep (the main sea or the subterranean watersupply)

8.brief: wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause

9.brief: a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a tree (from its firmness); hence, wood (plural sticks)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a cedar tree (from the tenacity of its roots)

10.brief: alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
properly, a dumb beast; especially any large quadruped or animal (often collective)
a reptile or any other rapidly moving animal
an edge or extremity; specifically (of a bird or army) a wing, (of a garment or bedclothing) a flap, (of the earth) a quarter, (of a building) a pinnacle

11.brief: the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a head person (of any rank or class)

to judge, i.e. pronounce sentence (for or against); by implication, to vindicate or punish; by extenssion, to govern; passively, to litigate (literally or figuratively)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

12.brief: properly, selected, i.e. a youth (often collective)
properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and
a virgin (from her privacy); sometimes (by continuation) a bride; also (figuratively) a city or state
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
(concretely) a boy (as active), from the age of infancy to adolescence; by implication, a servant; also (by interch. of sex), a girl (of similar latitude in age)

above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

14.brief: to be high actively, to rise or raise (in various applications, literally or figuratively)
